cause.description:
The horrific Kelo v. City of New London decision in the summer of 2005 is only the tip of the iceberg in government's assault on our property rights. A government that ignores the rule of law is far more dangerous to our liberty than any terrorist or foreign aggressor.
1. All takings must be done according to the 5th Amendment.
2. No property can be taken by government for private developers.
3. Restrictions on the use of private property must be reasonable.
cause.name: Protect property rights
